lines: Whenever i get to a new place, i stand back and drink it in,
relish the feeling of seeing something i have never seen.
I don't know quite what i'm looking for,
something only birds see.
An imperceptible difference,
in the patterns as they move.
If i had a hundred eyes,
they would be pointing at something i haven't seen.
If i had a pair of wings,
i would be flying towards something that isn't there yet.
Something that i only feel,
like the silence of the morning before the light hits.
When the grass heads are still,
and the droplets on the window pain hang weightlessly,
and then 't dawns on me it's real,
the dull rumbling of existence that is there
whenever i close my eyes,
whenever the sun hasn't yet to rise.
As i stand in the doorway of the world,
i look out and see the air lit by the evening light,
rays converging on a point behind the clouds,
i see they promise me and pure and unimaginable bliss.
And i feel totally at peace,
knowing that it's out there â€“ even if i never reach it.
Like i'm looking at a house nestled in the hillside,
so beautiful it makes me ache.
I'm just happy that someone gets to live there,
even if it's never me.
It's like i'm plugged in to the Earth.
It's like i'm tuned in to the very sky above me.
Whenever i close my eyes,
and forget that i even have a body.
Whenever i close my eyes,
it's a blessing.
extended_title: Whenever I Get to a New Place
